snippet: The conventional wisdom among many who work on or follow Wall Street is that generations of Americans have given up on stocks, but this is not the case.
abstract: Conventional wisdom among many who work on or follow Wall Street is that generations of Americans have given up on stocks, but this is not the case; Investment Company Institute reports there is more than $5.7 trillion in stock mutual funds alone; most investors believe they will have to rely on stock market if they want to retire comfortably.
lead_paragraph: The conventional wisdom among many who work on or follow Wall Street is that generations of Americans have given up on stocks, but this is not the case.

headline.seo: Many Still Consider Stocks the Best Investment Option
headline.main: The Death of Equities Seems Exaggerated
headline.print_headline: The Death of Equities Seems Exaggerated
